Manx: Ta’n ghrain houree soilshean dy çheh
English: The summer sun is shining hot,
Diplomatic: Ta’n ghrain houree soljean dy chea

Manx: As conney freoaie çheet reesht ayns blaa
English: And heather comes back into flower
Diplomatic: As chonney fraie cheet ressht ayns blaa

Manx: Ta’n gheay wooar hene er gholl gys shee
English: The great wind itself has pacified
Diplomatic: Ta’n ghey wooar hene er gholl gys shee

Manx: Ta’n imbagh aalin gerjagh mee
English: The beautiful season comforts me
Diplomatic: Ta’n imbagh aalin gherjagh mee

Manx: Ta tonnyn freeynagh yn vooir mooar
English: The raging waves of the great sea
Diplomatic: Ta thonyn freeanagh yn muir mooar

Manx: Er duittym sheese nish, feagh dy liooar
English: Have fallen down now; calm enough,
Diplomatic: Er duittym sheese nish feagh dy liooar

Manx: Dagh cronk as coan ayns coamrey glass
English: Every hill and valley in green clothing
Diplomatic: Dagh cronk as coan ayns coamrey glass

Manx: Lesh lussreeyn ta çheet er-ash
English: With plants that are coming into season
Diplomatic: Lesh loddryen ta cheet erash

Manx: Ta’n imbagh fouyr er jeet dy jeean
English: The autumnal season has come suddenly
Diplomatic: Ta’n imbagh fouyr er jeet dy jeean

Manx: Ny magheryn geayney ta gaase creen
English: The vivid green fields that ripen
Diplomatic: Ny maghryn gheiney ta gaase chreen

Manx: As labreeyn vees er ny laccal
English: And labourers will be required
Diplomatic: As labreeyn vess er ny laal

Manx: Ny messyn sourey dy hauail
English: To save the summer fruit
Diplomatic: Ny messyn sourey dy hauail

Manx: Agh bee yn geurey fluigh as feayr
English: But the winter will be wet and cold
Diplomatic: Agh be yn geurey fluigh as feeayr

Manx: Çheet reesht ayns traa gerrid dy liooar;
English: Coming back soon enough;
Diplomatic: Cheet reesht ayns tra gherryd dy lioor

Manx: Yn traa nagh voddym soie dy scrieu
English: The time when I cannot sit to write
Diplomatic: Yn tra nagh vodym soie dy scrieu

Manx: Fo skell ny greiney er yn clieau
English: Under the ray of the sun, on the mountain
Diplomatic: Fo skell ny ghrainey er yn chlieu

Manx: Nagh vel ain coontey ayns yn Ghoo
English: Do we not have a reckoning in the Word,
Diplomatic: Nagh vel ain coontey ayns yn ghoo

Manx: Quoi ren dy chooilley nhee y chroo
English: Which created everything,
Diplomatic: Quoi ren dy chooilley nhee y chroo

Manx: Syn aer erskyn as er yn ooir
English: In the sky above and on the Earth,
Diplomatic: Sy’n aer erskin as er yn ooir

Manx: As cummal seose eh lesh e phooar
English: And upholds it with his power?
Diplomatic: Aas commal seose as lesh y phooar

Manx: O cur dooin graase chouds ta shin bio
English: O give us grace whilst we live,
Diplomatic: O cur dooin graase chouds ta shin bio

Manx: Dy hirveish Oo ayns yn vea shoh
English: To serve You in this life
Diplomatic: Dy herveish Oo ayns yn vea shoh

Manx: As lheein dagh annym lesh Dty ghraih
English: And fill every soul with Your love
Diplomatic: As lhinn dagh annym lesh dy ghraih

Manx: Gys nee mayd cur my-ner Dty oaie
English: Until we behold your face
Diplomatic: Gus nee mayd curmerner dy oie

Manx: O Yee, ta liauyragh magh my vea
English: O God, who lengthens out my life
Diplomatic: O Yee ta liuragh magh my vea

Manx: Er coontey Chreest, jean mee livrey
English: On account of Christ, deliver me
Diplomatic: Er coontey Chreest jean mee lhivrey

Manx: Er voish dagh loght as deyrey baaish
English: From every sin and mortal condemnation
Diplomatic: Er voish dagh loght as deyrey baash

Manx: As saue my annym liorish graase
English: And save my soul through grace
Diplomatic: As saue my annym liorish graase

Manx: July yn nah laa, ayns yn vlein hoght cheead yeig kiare feed as nuy jeig.
English: July the second, in the year eighteen hundred and ninety-nine.
Diplomatic: July yn nah laa, ayns yn vlein hoght cheead yeig kiar feed as nee jeig

Manx: Creneash.
English: Cregneash.
Diplomatic: Cregnaish

Manx: Screeuit Liorish Edward Faragher
English: Written By Edward Faragher
Diplomatic: scrieut Liorish Edward Faragher
